newsitem.title: USA: US late heat gains on ACCESS after bullish APIs.
newsitem.headline: US late heat gains on ACCESS after bullish APIs.

text.p: U.S. spot heating oil prices jumped over a half cent in after-hours ACCESS trade following weekly API data showing a significant draw on stocks in the key East Coast heating market, players said.
November heating oil futures prices climbed to about 73.60 cents a gallon, recovering half of distillate's losses in earlier NYMEX trade. Differentials were stable, traders said.

Although distillates grew by 673,000 barrels nationwide, heating oil stocks fell 189,000 barrels on the already seriously understocked East Coast, the world's largest heating oil market, the API said.

The drawdown put heating oil stocks in the region at 24.3 million barrels, 43 percent below last year -- worsening rather than improving the situation at a time of year when stocks are expected to build for the winter.
And low sulfur diesel stocks plunged by 728,000 barrels on the East Coast, the API said.
Some players tied the distillates falloff to continued U.S. exports to Europe, estimating almost four million barrels of U.S. distillates were fixed for shipment in the past two weeks.
